definition[0]: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you
example[0]: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
example[1]: Two trains collided head-on  (=when they were moving directly towards each other).
example[2]: I ran around the corner, and almost collided with Mrs Laurence.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say run into rather than collide with:
example[3]: Her car ran into the back of a truck.
definition[1]: to disagree strongly with a person or group, especially on a particular subject
example[4]: The president has again collided with Congress over his budget plans.
definition[2]: if two very different ideas, ways of thinking etc collide, they come together and produce an interesting result
example[5]: Istanbul, where East and West collide.
